feat(api): Add `action=force_auth` to GET /v1/authorization.

fix(error): AppError uses Error.captureStackTrace

The AppError constructor accepts a `stack` property in the options,
but previously always assigned `this.stack` to it, leading to Errors
with no stack trace. This was confusing our logging infrastructure, which
tries to improve the format of the `stack` property.

Closes #164

Merge pull request #152 from mozilla/register

Implements Client Management Endpoints

feat(clients): client registration apis

This adds 4 new routes to manage clients, besides the existing
GET /v1/client/:id. The new routes are:

- GET /v1/clients
- POST /v1/client
- POST /v1/client/:id
- DELETE /v1/client/:id

These 4 routes are protected via the same Bearer token oauth scheme
that the profile server uses. Currently, it's scope is `oauth`.

Besides requiring a bearer token with the above scope, the email
associated with the token must match a whitelist. This whitelist is in
the config as `admin.whitelist`. The default is a regex matching
`@mozilla\.com$` email addresses.

An additional precaution is that these routes are currently disabled
when `config.env === 'prod'`.

fixes #60

Merge pull request #205 from mozilla/rfk/last-auth-at

feat(api): add `last_auth_at` to token response schema.

feat(api): add `auth_at` to token response schema.

The `auth_at` field tells the relier the freshness of the fxa-auth-server
session that was used to complete the flow.  This can be used in conjunction
with `action=force_auth` to ensure that the user has explicitly re-entered
their password during the oauth flow.

is true.

fix(clients): fix server error when omitting optional fields in client registration

when omitting optional fields in client registration:

- coerce `can_grant` and `whitelisted` to booleans, rather than e.g. `undefined`
